1. Billie Eilish, Nicki Minaj, Jon Bon Jovi and over 200 artists call for protections against “predatory use of AI”  CNBC
  2. Nicki Minaj, Billie Eilish, Katy Perry and other musicians sign letter against irresponsible AI  TechCrunch
  3. “Some of the biggest and most powerful companies are, without permission, using our work to train AI models...This assault on human creativity must be stopped”: Pearl Jam, The Cure, R.E.M. attack “predatory” use of AI in music  Louder
  4. “This Assault on Human Creativity Must Be Stopped”: Jon Bon Jovi, Pearl Jam, and Others Take a Stand Against AI  American Songwriter
  5. Katy Perry, Billie Eilish, Miranda Lambert and More Sign Open Letter Against 'AI Music-Generation Technology'  PEOPLE

item.title: How to detect AI deepfakes - The Washington Post
item.description:
1. How to detect AI deepfakes  The Washington Post
  2. ‘Time is running out’: can a future of undetectable deepfakes be avoided?  The Guardian
  3. 'Is this a deepfake?' Why we're asking the wrong question  Tech Xplore
  4. Tools to detect audio deepfakes are in a race with technology  NPR
  5. Deepfakes Are Coming for the Financial Sector  The Wall Street Journal

item.title: Nvidia plans to build a $200 million AI center in Indonesia amid push into Southeast Asia - CNBC
item.description:
1. Nvidia plans to build a $200 million AI center in Indonesia amid push into Southeast Asia  CNBC
  2. Nvidia, Indosat plan $200 mln AI centre investment in Indonesia, government says  Reuters
  3. Nvidia eyes Indonesia for $200M AI center amid global AI scramble  Cointelegraph
  4. Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) Plans $200M AI Center in Indonesia - TipRanks.com  TipRanks
  5. Nvidia plans $200 million AI center in Indonesia  Quartz
